questions.text: Round ligament terminates at upper end of which structure ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) A. A The round ligament of the uterus originates at the uterine horns, passes through the inguinal canal, and terminates at the labia majora, specifically the upper part of the labia majora. In the image, label A correctly points to the labia majora, making it the right answer. Incorrect options: B. B Label B represents the labia minora, which lies inside the labia majora and does not receive the round ligament. It is not related to the termination point of the round ligament. C. C Label C indicates the mons pubis, which is the fatty tissue over the pubic symphysis. Although it is in the anterior vulvar region, it is not the termination point of the round ligament. D. D Label D points to the anus or perineal body area, which lies posterior to the vaginal opening. This structure is unrelated to the round ligament, which lies more anteriorly and superiorly.

questions.text: Which part in above image is opened during colpotomy for drainage of pus ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Pouch of douglous -.The peritoneum is firmly attached to the anterior and posterior walls of the uterus and upper one-third of the posterior vaginal wall where from where it is reflected over the rectum. The pouch, so formed, is called pouch of Douglas It is the deepest part of pelvis in erect position. Drainage of Pus from this part is known as Colpotomy (Ref dutta textbook of obstetrics/8th edition/4-5)

questions.text: Shortest diameter is:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Ref Dc Dutta textbook of obstetrics/ 8th edition/ 100 B obstetric conjugate is the It is the distance between the midpoint of the sacral promontory to prominent bony projection in the midline on the inner surface of the symphysis pubis. It is the shortest anteroposterior diameter in the anteroposterior plane of the inlet. It measures 10 cm (4"). Option A Diagonal conjugate: It is the distance between the lower border of symphysis pubis to the midpoint on the sacral promontory. It measures 12 cm (4 ¾") Option C True conjugate (Syn: Anteroposterior conjugate, anatomical conjugate, conjugate vera): It is the distance between the midpoint of the sacral promontory to the inner margin of the upper border of symphysis pubis . It measures 11 cm (4 ¼")

questions.text: Identify the structure shown in image and match the day of development during embryonic period
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) STEM VILLI arise from the chorionic plate and extends to the basal plate. With the progressive development — primary, secondary and tertiary villi are formed. Functional unit of the placenta is called a fetal cotyledon or placentome, which is derived from a major primary stem villus. These major stem villi pass down through the intervillous space to anchor onto the basal plate Primary villi develop on day 13th secondary villi on day 16th and tertiary villi on day 21st of embryonic period.

questions.text: Which structure is avascular and provides maximum tensile strength ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Amnion is the inner most layer which is avascular and provides maximum tensile strength, it is derived from fetal endoderm (Ref Williams textbook of obstetrics/ 25th edition/ 93)

questions.text: Identify the type of placenta ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Bilobate placenta- placenta have nearly equally sized discs, In these, the cord inserts between the two placental lobes—either into a connecting chorionic bridge or into intervening membranes. A placenta containing three or more equivalently sized lobes is rare and termed multilobate. Unlike this equal distribution, one or more disparately smaller accessory lobes—succenturiate lobes—may develop in the membranes at a distance from the main placenta Battledore Placenta – when Umblical Cord attaches at margin and not at centre Velamentous – when the vessels separate before reaching the margin, this type of placenta is velamentous placenta

questions.text: levator anii muscles is formed by
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Pelvic floor is a muscular partition which separates the pelvic cavity from the anatomical perineum. It consists of three sets of muscles on either side—pubococcygeus, puborectalis and iliococcygeus. these are collectively called levator anii (Ref dutta textbook of obstetrics/ eighth edition/ 11

questions.text: Chose the correct option ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Nulliparous cervix is conical with a round external os. In parous women, it becomes cylindrical and the external os is a transverse patulous slit and may admit the tip of the finger However, as a result of operative manipulation even a nulliparous cervix may be torn and resembles a multiparous cervix.

questions.text: Which type of Placenta is associated with higher rates of low Apgar scores, stillbirth and preterm delivery ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) With velamentous insertion, the umbilical vessels characteristically travel within the membranes before reaching the placental margin vessels are vulnerable to compression, which may lead to fetal hypoperfusion and academia and Higher associated rates of low Apgar scores, stillbirth, preterm delivery, and small for gestational age have been noted (Ref williams textbook of obstetrics/25th edition/118)

questions.text: Identify the technique in given image ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Culdocentesis: This technique is used to diagnose haemoperitonium with a 16- to 18-gauge spinal needle attached to a syringe, the cul-de-sac is entered through the posterior vaginal fornix as upward traction is applied to the cervix with a tenaculum. (Ref Williams textbook of obstetrics/25th edition/375)

questions.text: Identify the image and chromosomal Pattern seen in this is
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Gross specimen with characteristic vesicles of variable size shows complete H.mole Complete moles most often have a diploid chromosomal composition. These usually are 46,XX and result from androgenesis, meaning both sets of chromosomes are paternal in origin. The chromosomes of the ovum are either absent or inactivated. The ovum is fertilized by a haploid sperm, which then duplicates its own chromosomes after meiosis. Less commonly, the chromosomal pattern may be 46,XY or 46,XX and due to fertilization by two sperm, that is, dispermic fertilization or dispermy While in partial mole 69 XXX 69 XXY pattern is seen

questions.text: Sonogram shown below is seen in ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Image shows Sagittal view of a uterus with a complete hydatidiform mole. The characteristic “snowstorm” appearance is due to an echogenic uterine mass, marked by calipers, that has numerous anechoic cystic spaces. Notably, a fetus and amnionic sac are absent. (Ref William book of obstetrics/25th edition/391)

questions.text: Which diameter of fetal skull takes part in engagement in the image shown below ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Engagement diameter in face presentation with complete extension is – Submento-bregmatic Other diameters involved in different presentations are : (Ref – dutta textbook of obstetrics/8th edition/ 96)

questions.text: Identify the type of grip shown in image below ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Above image shows fourth leopold grip that is Pelvic grip : The examination is done facing the patient’s feet. Four fingers of both the hands are placed on either side of the midline in the lower pole of the uterus and parallel to the inguinal ligament. The fingers are pressed downward and backward in a manner of approximation of finger tips to palpate the part occupying the lower pole of the uterus (presentation). If it is head, the characteristics to note are: (1) precise presenting area (2) attitude and (3) engagement

questions.text: Which is the most common position shown in given image ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) LOT – Vertex occupying the left anterior quadrant of the pelvis is the most common position

questions.text: Chose the correct option ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Divergence of the examining fingers of both the hands while trying to push downward on the lower abdomen indicates engagement of head While Convergence of the fingers while palpating the lateral aspects of the fetal head indicates that the head is not yet engaged.

questions.text: Image shows measurement of which pelvic diameter ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Diagonal conjugate - Diagonal conjugate: It is the distance between the lower border of symphysis pubis to the midpoint on the sacral promontory. It measures 12 cm (4 ¾") Two fingers are introduced into the vagina taking aseptic precautions. The fingers are to follow the anterior sacral curvature. In normal pelvis, it is difficult to feel the sacral promontory or at best can be felt with difficulty. However, in order to reach the promontory, the elbow and the wrist are to be depressed sufficiently while the fingers are mobilized in upward direction. The point at which the bone recedes from the fingers is the sacral promontory. The fingers are then mobilized under the symphysis pubis and a marking is placed over the gloved index finger by the index finger of the left hand.

questions.text: Identify the position in the image
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Position refers to the relationship of an arbitrarily chosen portion of the fetal presenting part to the right or left side of the birth canal. Accordingly, with each presentation, there may be two positions—right or left. The fetal occiput, chin (mentum), and sacrum are the determining points in vertex, face, and breech presentations, respectively. Because the presenting part may be in either the left or right position, there are left and right occipital (LO and RO), left and right mental (LM and RM), and left and right sacral (LS and RS) designations.

choices.text: A-Reverse EDF B- normal C- AEDF D- Reduced EDF
A-normal B-AEDF C- Reduced EDF D-Reverse EDF
A-normal B-Reduced EDF C- AEDF D- Reverse EDF
A- Reverse EDF B- normal C- Reduced EDF C- AEDF

questions.text: Umblical artery flow velocity waveform is seen in given image, chose the correct option among it
questions.solution: Correct Answre (C) A-normal B-Reduced EDF C- AEDF D- Reverse EDF Arterial Doppler (umbilical artery) waveforms are helpful to assess the downstream vascular resistance. The arterial Doppler waveform is used to measure the peak systolic (S), peak diastolic (D) and mean (M) volumes. From these values s/D ratio, pulsatility index (Pi) [PI = (S–D)/M] or resistance index (ri) [RI = (S–D)/S] are calculated. Reduced or absent or reversed end diastolic flow- indicates Failure of villous trophoblast invasion hence ↑ resistance in fetoplacental circulation → IUGR, pre-eclampsia

questions.text: Choose the correct option (PGI TYPE)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (a d) Central separation (Schultze): Detachment of placenta from its uterine attachment starts at the center resulting in opening up of few uterine sinuses and accumulation of blood behind the placenta (retroplacental hematoma). With increasing contraction, more and more detachment occurs facilitated by weight of the placenta and retroplacental blood until whole of the placenta gets detached. Marginal separation (Mathews-Duncan): Separation starts at the margin as it is mostly unsupported. With progressive uterine contraction, more and more areas of the placenta get separated. Marginal separation is found more frequently.

questions.text: A primigravida at 37 week of gestation reported to labour room with heavy bleeding per vaginum and placenta shown in image . The fetal heart rate was normal at the time of examination. The best management option for her is:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) The indications of definitive management (delivery) are : Bleeding occurs at or after 37 weeks of pregnancy. Patient is in labor. Patient is in exsanguinated state on admission. Bleeding is continuing and of moderate degree. Baby with nonreassuring cardiac status or dead or known to be congenitally deformed. Cesarean delivery is done for all women with sonographic evidence of placenta previa where placental edge is within 2 cm from the internal os. It is especially indicated if it is posterior or thick (RCOG 2005). Hence answer here would be option B

questions.text: Sutures applied here are used in treatment of :
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Image shows B-Lynch compression suture method work by tamponade (like bimanual compression) of the uterus. Success rate is about 80% and it can avoid hysterectomy.

choices.text: A- percreta B– increta C– accreta
A- accrete B- increta C- percreta
A- increta B- percreta C – accreta
A- accrete B – percreta C – increta

questions.text: Select the correct option for type of placenta ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) A- Placenta Percreta – Placenta attaches itself and grows through the uterus and extending to nearby organs, such as bladder B- Placenta Increta – The placenta attaches itself even more deeply into muscle wall of uterus C- Placenta Accreta – Placenta attaches itself too deeply and too firmly into uterus

questions.text: Which one of the following is not an operation for condition shown in the image
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Image showing inversion of uterus During inversion - Replacement of the uterususing hydrostatic method (O’Sullivan’s) under general anesthesia is to be done along with resuscitative measures. Reposition may be done by abdominal operation (Haultain’s operation). Spincelli operation – an operation splitting the anterior wall of prolapsed uterus in utrine inversion and reversing the organ preliminary to reduction Hence above three surgeries are used in uterine inversion While fenton’s operation is used for episiotomy scar

choices.text: Dichorionic and monoamniotic in dizygotic twins
Dichorionic and monoamniotic in monozygotic twins
Monochorionic and monoamniotic in dizygotic twins

questions.text: Identify the type of twin pregnancy shown in image below
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Monochorionic diamniotic in monozygotic twins Dizygotic twins: There are two placentae, either completely separated or more commonly fused at the margin appearing to be one (9 out of 10). Each fetus is surrounded by a separate amnion and chorion. Hence placenta here is dichorionic diamniotic While in monozygotic twins if division occur with in 72 hrs it is dichorionic diamniotic If division occurs in 4-8 days it is monochorionic diamniotic If division occurs in 8-12 days it is Monochorionic and monoamniotic If division occurs .12 days it is conjoint twins

questions.text: Sign shown in usg is seen in ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) “Twin peak” sign. In dichorionic diamniotic twin gestations, the chorion and amnion for each twin reflect away from the fused placenta to form the intertwin membrane. A potential space exists in the intertwin membrane, which is filled by proliferating placental villi giving rise to the twin peak sign. Twin peak sign appears as a triangle with the base at the chorionic surface and the apex in the intertwin membrane.

questions.text: Identify the type of uterine rupture shown in image ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Obstructive rupture Obstructive type, the rupture involves the anterior lower segment transversely and often extends upward along the lateral uterine wall. The margins are ragged and necrosed Spontaneous nonobstructive rupture usually involves the upper segment and often involves the fundus. Iatrogenic rupture can involve any part of uterus usually fundal region

choices.text: Admit the patient, start antihypertensive and continue pregnancy till term
Admit the patient, start antihypertensive, mg SO4 and terminate the pregnancy
Admit oral antihypertensives and follow up in outpatient department

questions.text: A female of 36 weeks gestation presents with following signs shown in image patient have hypertension, blurring of vision and headache. Her blood pressure reading was 180/120 mm Hg and 174/110 mm Hg after 20 minutes. How will you manage the patient?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Signs of impending eclampsia are : Epigastric pain due to subcapsular hematoma Headache / dizziness due to cerebral hypoxia) Blurring of vision due to hypertensive retinopathy ( diplopia / scotoma/blindness) Blindness is due to hypoxic injury to occipital lobe Here patient is of impending eclampsia Best management in patients of impending eclampsia – admit the patient Start antihypertensive drugs indication for antihypertensive are >160/110mm of hg labetalol is DOC in pregnancy Iv Mgso4 is started to prevent chances of seizures. It acts as a membrane stabilizer and neuroprotector. Next step is termination of pregnancy – all the patients of Gest HTN and mild pre eclampsia should be delivered by 37 weeks while those of severe PE should be delivered by 34 weeks

questions.text: A 29 year old eclamptic woman develop convulsions. The first measure to be done is:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Measures in case of eclampsia : Call for extra help (Communication) To put patient in left lateral recumbent position Maintain oral airway t O2 inhalation – nonbreather mask; 10 L/minute Commence IV lines; 1 or 2 wide bore cannulas Foley catheter with urometer t To monitor O2 saturation; pulse oximeter (SPO2 > 95%) Control of seizures: MgSO4, (IV/IM regimens) So answer is option D

questions.text: A patient presented with c/o bleeding per vagina and history of high Bp since last 1 month, patient is on irregular medication on PA ut tense and tender and slightly > POG FHS - NL, patient was taken for urgent laparotomy, appearance of uterus is as shown in image, identify the condition ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) APH- antepartum haemorrhage Patient with abruption present with above clinical picture, due to collection of blood behind placenta, uterus appears to be tense and tender on PA examination Fetal deaths are due to prematurity and anoxia due to placental separation. In abruption there is massive intravasation of blood into the uterine musculature upto the serous coat known as covulare uterus as shown in image . The condition can only be diagnosed on laparotomy.

questions.text: Identify the procedure shown in the image ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Direct (indirect ) electric foetal monitoring - Direct fetal heart measurement is accomplished by attaching a bipolar spiral electrode directly to the fetus.

questions.text: CTG shown in given image is ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) CTG shows variable deceleration that is the intermittent periodic slowing (variable) of FHR with rapid onset and recovery. Decelerations are variable in all respect of size, shape, depth, duration and timing to the uterine contractions. It is thought to indicate cord compression and may disappear with the change in position of the patient. It is the most common type. Accelerations often precede and follow the deceleration. (Ref dutta textbook of obstetrics/ 8th edition /695)

questions.text: Patient savita is known hypertensive since last 2 months of pregnancy had an episode of BPV and presented to emergency with and CTG shown below, make the correct diagnosis ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) CTG showing late deceleration which begins after the onset of the uterine contraction. Usually, the onset, nadir and recovery of the decleration occur after the start, peak and end of the uterine contraction respectively. Nadir occurs 20 seconds after the peak of the contraction and FHR returns to normal after the contraction is over. It suggests uteroplacental insufficiency and fetal hypoxia (50%). „ Causes of late deceleration: Placental pathology (postmaturity, hypertension, diabetes, placental abruption) Excessive uterine contractions Injudicious use of oxytocin Regional anesthesia (spinal of epidural) (Ref dutta textbook of obstetrics/ 8th edition /695)

questions.text: Identify the instrument shown in image?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Karman’s cannula Karman’s cannula is used for suction and evacuation. These are of different sizes (4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10 and 12 mm). Appropriate size of the cannula (diameter in mm) needed for a particular case, is same to the duration of pregnancy in weeks. In general, the size of the pregnant uterus (weeks) and the size of the cannula (mm) are: 4–6 weeks size with 4–7mmcannula; 7–9 weeks size with 5–10 mm cannula and for 9–12 weeks with 8–12 mm size cannula.

questions.text: identify the type of pelvis ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Anthropoid pelvis Various type of pelvis as per Caldwell moloy classification are

choices.text: Can be used as an emergency contraceptive

questions.text: Choose the correct option for contraceptive device shown in image ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Levonorgestrole containing device is a 3rd generation contraceptive device Life span is 5 years while cu containing IUCDs have 10 years of life span Mirena is atype of LNG containing IUCD, it contains 52 mg of LNG and 20 microgm is realised per day LNG IUDs can not be used as emergency contraceptives as there is delay in action on other hand cu containing contraceptive devices are effective immediately as emergency contraception

choices.text: 0.03 mg ethinyloestradiol + 0.15 mg LNG + 7 ferrous fumerate
0.06 mg ethinyloestradiol + 0.15 mg LNG + 7 ferrous fumerate
0.03 mg ethinyloestradiol + 1.5 mg LNG + 7 ferrous fumerate
0.06 mg ethinyloestradiol + 1.5 mg LNG + 7 ferrous fumerate

questions.text: OC pills shown in the image contains ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) OC pills contain 0.03mg ethinyloestradiol + 0.15 mg LNG + 7 ferrous fumerate tablets

questions.text: Identify the procedure ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) A loop is made by holding the tube by an Allis forceps in such a way that the major part of the loop consists mainly of isthmus and part of the ampullary part of the tube Through an avascular area in the mesosalpinx, a needle threaded with No. “0” chromic catgut is passed and both the limbs of the loop are firmly tied together. About 1–1.5 cm of the segment of the loop distal to the ligature is excised. The tube is so excised as to leave behind about 1.5 cm of intact tube adjacent to uterus.

questions.text: Identify the device shown in image ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Essure is a 4 cm long, 2 mm diameter, microcoil (spring like device) made of nickel-titanium steel alloy coil within which lie polyethylene terephthalate fibers It is inserted into each Fallopian tube transcervically using a hysteroscope. The tube is blocked permanently when scar tissue grows into the device. To ensure proper placement and total occlusion of Essure a hysterosalpingogram is done 3 months after. Its success rate is similar to surgical sterilization (99.74%). For the first 3 months the woman needs to use a temporary contraceptive method in addition, till the scar tissue is formed.

questions.text: Which maneuver is shown in image ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Mauriceau smellie veit maneuver is used in breech delivery for after coming head extraction by applying malar flexion.

questions.text: If partograph of a patient is in right of action line, what is management of choice ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) No change in cervical dilatation even after 4hrs of adequate uterine contraction needs intervention

questions.text: Diagnosis of condition given in image is made by ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Image showing fetus with anencephaly , The anomaly results from deficient development of the vault of the skull and brain tissue, but the facial portion is normal. The pituitary gland is often absent or hypoplastic In the first half of pregnancy, the diagnosis is made by elevated alpha-fetoprotein in amniotic fluid. Diagnosis is confirmed by sonography In the latter half of pregnancy, the diagnosis is difficult especially when associated with hydramnios. Inability to locate the fetal head on abdominal palpation arouses the suspicion. Even on internal examination, the diagnosis of face presentation is made. Confirmation is done by sonography

questions.text: Quantity of hormone released by device shown below is ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) This is mirena, IUD. It contains 52 mg of LNG and release it @ 20 mcg/d. Hence also called LNG 20. The main site of action is endometrium and inhibition of implantation and of inhibition of fertilization by initiating a sterile inflammatory reaction that is toxic to sperm and ova . Its also makes cervical mucus thick.

questions.text: Identify the procedure shown in image ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Image shows McDonald cerclage procedure for incompetent cervix. Start of the cerclage procedure with a no. 2 monofilament suture being placed in the body of the cervix very near the level of the internal os. Continuation of suture placement in the body of the cervix so as to encircle the os. Encirclement completed. And The suture is tightened around the cervical canal sufficiently to reduce the diameter of the canal to 5 to 10 mm, and then the suture is tied. The effect of the suture placement on the cervical canal is apparent. A second suture placed somewhat higher may be of value if the first is not in close proximity to the internal os. (Williams textbook of obstetrics/25th edition/355)

choices.text: Instrument is used for dilatation of cervix
It helps to know position of uterus and length of cavity
It helps in removal of IUCD

questions.text: Chose the correct statement for the instrument given in image:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) UTERINE SOUND: It is an olive pointed, graduated, malleable, metallic uterine sound. Uses: To know the position of the uterus and the length of the uterine cavity prior to dilatation of the cervix in D + E operation. To sound the uterine cavity to detect any foreign body (IUCD). It acts as a first dilator of the cervical canal .

choices.text: Procedure is done commonly between 11 -13 weeks of pregnancy
This is performed using 22 G- 24 g spinal needle
USG have no role in procedure
Needle injuries to fetus is common

questions.text: Chose the correct statement for the procedure shown in image ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Image showing amniocentesis Transabdominal withdrawal of amnionic fluid is generally done between 15 and 20 weeks Indications include diagnosis of fetal genetic disorders, congenital infections, and alloimmunization, as well as assessment of fetal lung maturity. Amniocentesis is performed using aseptic technique, with a 20- or 22-gauge spinal needle and ultrasound guidance The needle is inserted perpendicular to the skin and guided into the deepest portion of the fluid pocket, avoiding fetal parts and umbilical cord

choices.text: Typically performed between 14 to 16 weeks’ gestation
Performed using an 14- or 16-gauge spinal needle
Associated with limb reduction defects if performed before 10 weeks

questions.text: Choose the correct option
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Cvs - Biopsy of chorionic villi is typically performed between 10 and 13 weeks’ gestation Chorionic villi may be obtained transcervically or transabdominally, using aseptic technique, above image shows tranvaginal technique Transcervical CVS is performed using a specifically designed catheter made from flexible polyethylene that contains a blunt-tipped, malleable stylet. Transabdominal sampling is performed using an 18- or 20-gauge spinal needle. With either technique, transabdominal sonography is used to guide the catheter or needle into the early placenta—chorion frondosum, followed by aspiration of villi into a syringe containing tissue culture media An early problem with CVS was its association with limb-reduction defects and oromandibular limb hypogenesis. These were subsequently found to be associated with procedures performed at 7 weeks’ gestation.

questions.text: Following comes under what classification of breech ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Incomplete breech Classification of breech : Complete (Flexed breech): The normal attitude of full flexion is maintained. Thighs are flexed at hips and legs at knees. The presenting part consists of two buttocks, external genitalia and two feet. It is commonly present in multiparae (10%). Incomplete includes - Breech with extended legs (Frank breech Footling and knee presentation

questions.text: Identify the type of twin with the given image
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Image shows Dichorionic diamnionic twin placenta. The membrane partition that separated twin fetuses is elevated and consists of chorion (c) between two amnions (a). (Ref williams textbook of obstetric/25th edition/869)

questions.text: Identify the type of forceps
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Image showing SHORT CURVED OBSTETRIC FORCEPS (WRIGLEY’S FORCEPS) It can only be used as outlet forceps for extraction of the head.

questions.text: A 26-year-old woman came in with 12 weeks of missed periods. An ultrasound of her abdomen and pelvis indicated a twin pregnancy, as depicted in the accompanying image. This particular type of twin gestation occurs when the inner cell mass divides:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Within 3 days after fertilization. The image illustrates the lambda sign, or twin peak sign, which is characteristic of a dichorionic diamniotic pregnancy. Division of the inner cell mass within the first three days post-fertilization leads to this type of twin arrangement. Chorionicity of the placenta is most accurately assessed through ultrasound between 10 to 13 weeks of pregnancy. In cases of dichorionic twins, a prominent septum can be observed between the two gestational sacs.

questions.text: A 25 year old primigravida giving birth to following child . What condition in the mother is associated with such fetal anomaly?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Pregestational Diabetes mellitus Option B:- Caudal regression syndrome is a rare congenital abnormality in which a segment of the spine and spinal cord fails to develop. The severity of the morphologic derangement inversely correlates with residual spinal cord function.

questions.text: The method shown in the image is:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Burns Marshall Technique The image shows marshall burns technique used in the delivery of aftercoming head in breech delivery. Technique: • Baby is allowed to hang by its own weight till the nape of neck is visible. • When the nape of neck is visible under the pubic arch, baby is grasped by the ankles • Baby is swung in an arc in an upward and forward direction towards the mother’s abdomen

questions.text: Identify the maneuver shown in the image below:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Ritgen’s maneuver The above image depicts the Ritgen’s maneuver

questions.text: A primigravida woman gives birth to a baby with the following defect. Identify the anomaly.
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Craniorachischisis The above image showing anencephaly and a contiguous bony defect of the spine, is suggestive of craniorachischisis. It occurs due to failure of complete closure of the neural tube.

questions.text: You are performing a cardiotocograph on a woman in labor, and your findings are shown below. What could be the possible cause of these findings?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Umbilical cord compression The given cardiotocograph shows decelerations that are variable with respect to the size, shape, depth, duration, and timing of uterine contractions. This is indicative of variable decelerations, and the likely cause among the given options is umbilical cord compression.

questions.text: A pregnant woman presented with complaints of passing grape-like vesicles vaginally. A USG scan was done and is shown below. Which of the following hormonal levels need to be checked in this patient?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) hCG The given clinical scenario is suggestive of molar pregnancy and beta hCG levels need to be measured. Molar pregnancy may present with bleeding per vaginum or an acute discharge of vesicular mass per vaginum. On examination, the uterine size is more than the corresponding period of amenorrhea. It shows a characteristic snowstorm appearance on USG.

questions.text: A 33-year-old pregnant woman at 20 weeks of gestation has the following finding on USG. Identify the defect.
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Omphalocele The given ultrasound image shows an anterior abdominal wall defect through which abdominal contents have herniated (indicated with an asterisk). The extruded abdominal contents are covered in a sac. This is typical of omphalocele

questions.text: A 2-month pregnant woman undergoes a sonographic evaluation of fetal parameters. The parameter marked in the USG shown below best measures:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Gestational age The parameter shown in the ultrasonography image is crown- rump length (CRL), which is the most accurate parameter used for the sonographic estimation of gestational age in the first trimester. It has an accuracy range of ± 5 days.

questions.text: An Rh-negative patient who did not have access to antenatal care delivered a stillborn fetus as shown in the image. Which of the following is not associated with the fetal condition?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Oligohydramnios The pale, oedematous fetus in the image is suggestive of fetal hydrops. Fetal hydrops is associated with polyhydramnios, not oligohydramnios. It often occurs as an effect of iso-immunization in an Rh- negative pregnancy. Other complications that may occur are fetal anemia and hyperbilirubinemia.

questions.text: Identify the grip shown in the image below.
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Pelvic grip - First Grip (Fundal Grip) – Determines which fetal part (head or buttocks) is in the uterine fundus. - Second Grip (Umbilical Grip) – Identifies the fetal back and limbs to assess position. - Third Grip (Pawlik’s Grip) – Assesses fetal engagement by palpating above the pubic symphysis. - Fourth Grip (Pelvic Grip) – Confirms fetal head flexion and descent into the pelvis.

choices.text: Normal diagonal conjugate, reassuring for a vaginal delivery
Short diagonal conjugate, indicating cephalopelvic disproportion
Long diagonal conjugate, suggestive of a contracted pelvis
Average diagonal conjugate, no specific concerns

questions.text: A 28-year-old pregnant woman at 36 weeks of gestation presents for a routine antenatal check-up. During the pelvic examination, the obstetrician measures the diagonal conjugate. The measurement is found to be 11 cm. What is the significance of this measurement?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Short diagonal conjugate, indicating cephalopelvic disproportion Explanation: The diagonal conjugate is an important measurement in obstetrics that helps assess the adequacy of the pelvis for childbirth. It is the distance between the lower border of the symphysis pubis and the sacral promontory. In this case, a measurement of 11 cm at 36 weeks of gestation is shorter than the average diagonal conjugate. The normal range for diagonal conjugate is approximately 12.5 cm to 13.5 cm. A shorter diagonal conjugate may indicate a contracted pelvis, which can lead to difficulties in the descent of the fetal head during labor, known as cephalopelvic disproportion (CPD).

questions.text: Identify the type of placenta previa shown in the image
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Type 3 Type 1 (Low-lying) – Placenta is near but does not reach the cervix. Type 2 (Marginal) – Placenta touches the cervix but does not cover it. Type 3 (Partial) – Placenta partially covers the cervix. Type 4 (Complete) – Placenta fully covers the cervix Investigation of choice in placenta previa is CS

questions.text: Identify the maneuver shown in the image below:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Controlled cord traction or modified brandt Andrews method The Brandt-Andrews method is a technique used during the third stage of labor to facilitate the delivery of the placenta while minimizing the risk of uterine inversion. This maneuver involves the following steps: 1. Patient Positioning: The patient lies in a supine position. 2. Uterine Support: The clinician places one hand just above the symphysis pubis to apply gentle upward pressure, stabilizing the uterus. 3. Cord Traction: With the other hand, the clinician holds the umbilical cord taut using an artery clamp.

questions.text: A pregnant female delivered a baby with normal, expulsion of an intact placenta. After half hour she started bleeding per vaginaly. On examination she was hypotensive and boggy mass is palpated per abdomen. USG showed. retained placental tissues. Which of the following would be likely finding?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Placenta succenturiata Placenta succenturiata has one (usual) or more small lobes of placenta placed at a varying margin from the main placental margin. Aleash of vessels connects the small lobe with the main lobe. Many times, succenturiate is retained and it presents as postpartum haemorrhage which may be primary or secondary. Placenta membranacea is unduly large and thin. The placenta develops from both chorion frondosum and chorion leave. it increases chances of placenta previa, retained placenta, PPH. In placenta accreta, all or part of the placenta attaches abnormally to the myometrium. So, either whole or a part of placenta comes out causing PPH.

questions.text: A pregnant woman presented to the clinic with the given fetal presentation. What is the likely diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Frank breech A frank breech (otherwise known as an extended breech) is where the baby's legs are up next to its abdomen, with its knees straight and its feet next to its ears. This is the most common type of breech.

questions.text: Which pregnancy sign is shown below
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Piskaceks sign -These are probable signs of pregnancy seen on bimanual examination Piskacek’s Sign – Asymmetrical uterine enlargement due to implantation- 8 weeks Hegar’s Sign – Softening of the lower uterine segment- 6 weeks Goodell’s Sign – Softening of the cervix due to increased vascularity -6 weeks Osiander’s Sign – Pulsation of vaginal arteries felt on examination- 8 weeks

questions.text: In which type of pelvis will you see this fetal position
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) ANDROID This is ROP position commonly seen in android pelvis. Characteristics of android pevis : • Narrow subpubic angle • Heart shaped inlet • Prominent ischial spines • Funnel-shaped pelvic cavity Labour can be prolonged and can also result in deep transverse arrest

questions.text: A 26 year old pregnant woman has the following pattern of umbilical arteries on a Doppler. What does this pattern indicate?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Absence of end-diastolic flow Absent end-diastolic flow (AEDF) in the umbilical artery is a sign of placental resistance and can indicate fetal vascular stress. It can be a sign of fetal growth restriction (FGR) and is associated with poor fetal and neonatal outcomes.

questions.text: A second gravida with previous CS during repeat CS developed bleeding after delivery of fetus, hysterectomy was done and the specimen is shown below. What is diagnosis
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Placenta accreta Placenta Accreta Spectrum (PAS) refers to abnormal placental attachment to the uterine wall, preventing normal separation after delivery. It includes three types: 1. Placenta Accreta – Placenta attaches too deeply into the uterine wall but does not invade the muscle. 2. Placenta Increta – Placenta invades the uterine muscle (myometrium). 3. Placenta Percreta – Placenta penetrates through the entire uterine wall, potentially reaching nearby organs (e.g., bladder). Risk Factors: • Previous C-sections • Uterine surgeries • Placenta previa • Advanced maternal age
